org.mundo.rt
Class Publisher

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Publisher

public class Publisher
extends java.lang.Object

The Publisher class represents an advertisement and is used to send messages to a specific channel. Instances of Publisher can be created via Session objects.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler
See Also:
Session

Returns:
the channel object.

enableLocalLoopback

public void enableLocalLoopback(boolean b)
Enables or disables local loopback. If local loopback is enabled, subscribers in the same session may receive the published messages. By default, local loopback is disabled.

Parameters:
b - true to enable local loopback, or false to disable local loopback.

getLocalLoopback

public boolean getLocalLoopback()
Returns whether local loopback is enabled.

Returns:
true if local loopback is enabled, or false otherwise.

setParam

public void setParam(SubscriptionParameters p)
Sets subscription parameters.

Parameters:
p - the subscription parameters.

getParam

public SubscriptionParameters getParam()
Returns the subscription parameters.

Returns:
the subscription parameters.

isRelevant

public boolean isRelevant()
Returns whether this publisher is relevant. A publisher is relevant if there exists a subscriber that is covered by the advertisement described by this publisher.

Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the responsible messaging provider does not support this operation.

setSender

public void setSender(java.lang.Object obj)
Sets the sender object. The sole use of this concept is to associate user data with this publisher object. If a ClientStub is connected to this publisher, the sender object is set to the ClientStub.

getSender

public java.lang.Object getSender()
Returns the sender object.

public java.lang.String toString()
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
